title: refactor: Replace Volley by Picaso.
message:
refactor: Replace Volley by Picaso.

Square Picaso provides a transparent way of dealing with image caching,
eliminating the cumbersome LRU implementation and providing a more
readable code.

The material design color palette can be adjusted to the background
image, considering the its dominant, contrasting, and complementary
colors.

As soon as the image is downloaded by Picaso, those colors are
calculated by the command and new primary and accent colors are
generated. These are more harmonic with the background image.

title: refactor: Replace OkHttp by Retrofit in date and remote modules
message:
refactor: Replace OkHttp by Retrofit in date and remote modules

Current OkHttp version conflicts with latest one used by Picaso, so
the best approach is removing it completly in favor of Retrofit.

Instead of processe date attributes as strings, a better approach is
create a custom Gson (de)serializer (see http://goo.gl/DY4pH6).

title: feat: Create CursorRecyclerAdapter
message:
feat: Create CursorRecyclerAdapter

The framework does not provide a CursorAdapter for RecyclerView, so the
solution is create one inheriting from RecyclerView.Adapter and copy
all required methods from the original CursorAdapter.

title: style: Move Adapter to its own class.
message: style: Move Adapter to its own class.

title: feat: Create OnItemSelectedListener.
message:
feat: Create OnItemSelectedListener.

The RecyclerView does not have an setOnItemSelectedListener, so we need
to provide a OnItemSelectedListener to emulate the card selection.

The ArticleAdapter will implement the OnClickListener and associated
with the ViewHolder. When a card is clicked, it internally invokes the
OnItemSelectedListener interface method, that is implemented by the
ArticleListActivity and linked through a setter.
